```python
from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
scene.width = 700
scene.height = 400

# Cyber Input Variable
Height_I = 5

# Constants
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity (m/s^2)
v0 = 10  # initial velocity of the ball (m/s)
dt = 0.01  # time step

# Objects
ground = box(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), size=vector(30, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, Height_I, 0), radius=0.5, color=color.red)

# Initial conditions
ball.velocity = vector(v0, 0, 0)

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    
    ball.pos.x += ball.velocity.x * dt
    ball.velocity.y -= g * dt
    
    if ball.pos.y <= ball.radius:
        ball.velocity.y = -ball.velocity.y
    
    if ball.pos.x > ground.size.x / 2:
        ball.pos.x = -ground.size.x / 2
```

This code sets up the screen with the specified width and height, defines the initial height of the ball, and creates the necessary objects for the animation. The animation then simulates the horizontal projectile motion of a ball launched from the specified height with an initial velocity.
